# Installation

This chapter walks you through installing all the tools you need. Follow the sections in order.

## 1. Positron

Positron is a data science IDE built on VS Code, designed specifically for R and Python work.

### macOS

1. Download Positron from [https://positron.posit.co](https://positron.posit.co)
2. Open the `.dmg` file and drag Positron to your Applications folder
3. Open Positron from Applications

### Windows

1. Download Positron from [https://positron.posit.co](https://positron.posit.co)
2. Run the installer (`.exe` file)
3. Follow the installation prompts
4. Launch Positron from the Start menu

::: {.callout-tip}
## First Launch
When you first open Positron, it may ask to install recommended extensions. Accept these defaults.
:::

## 2. Conda (Miniforge)

We use Miniforge, a minimal conda installer that defaults to the conda-forge channel.

### macOS

Open Terminal and run:

```bash
# Download the installer
curl -L -O "https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Miniforge3-MacOSX-$(uname -m).sh"

# Run the installer
bash Miniforge3-MacOSX-$(uname -m).sh
```

Follow the prompts, accepting the defaults. When asked about initializing conda, say **yes**.

After installation, restart your terminal or run:

```bash
source ~/.zshrc
```

Verify the installation:

```bash
conda --version
```

### Windows

1. Download the Miniforge installer from [https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases)
   - Choose `Miniforge3-Windows-x86_64.exe`
2. Run the installer
3. Check "Add Miniforge3 to my PATH environment variable" during installation
4. Complete the installation

Open a new PowerShell or Command Prompt and verify:

```powershell
conda --version
```

## 3. R (using rig)

We use **rig** (R Installation Manager) to install and manage R versions. This makes it easy to install R, switch between versions, and keep R updated.

### macOS

First, install rig using Homebrew:

```bash
brew tap r-lib/rig
brew install --cask rig
```

Then install the latest R version:

```bash
rig add release
```

Verify the installation:

```bash
R --version
```

::: {.callout-tip}
## rig Commands
- `rig list` — See installed R versions
- `rig add release` — Install latest stable R
- `rig add devel` — Install development version
- `rig default <version>` — Set default R version
:::

### Windows

1. Download the rig installer from [https://github.com/r-lib/rig/releases](https://github.com/r-lib/rig/releases)
   - Choose `rig-windows-latest.exe`
2. Run the installer
3. Open a **new** PowerShell window and install R:

```powershell
rig add release
```

4. Verify:

```powershell
R --version
```

### Why rig?

- **Easy updates**: `rig add release` always gets the latest version
- **Multiple versions**: Install R 4.3 and R 4.4 side by side for testing
- **Clean uninstall**: `rig rm <version>` removes R cleanly
- **Consistent**: Same commands on macOS and Windows

## 4. Git

### macOS

Git may already be installed. Check by running:

```bash
git --version
```

If not installed, you'll be prompted to install the Xcode Command Line Tools. Accept the prompt.

Alternatively, install via Homebrew:

```bash
brew install git
```

### Windows

1. Download Git from [https://git-scm.com/download/win](https://git-scm.com/download/win)
2. Run the installer
3. Accept the default options (the defaults are good)
4. Verify in a new terminal:

```powershell
git --version
```

### Configure Git (Both Platforms)

Set your identity (use your real name and email):

```bash
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
```

## 5. GitHub Account

1. Go to [https://github.com](https://github.com) and create an account if you don't have one
2. We'll set up authentication in @sec-github-auth

## 6. Claude Code

Claude Code is an AI coding assistant that runs in your terminal.

### Prerequisites

You need Node.js 18+ installed:

**macOS:**
```bash
brew install node
```

**Windows:**
Download and install from [https://nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org) (LTS version).

### Install Claude Code

```bash
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```

### Authenticate

Run Claude Code once to authenticate:

```bash
claude
```

Follow the prompts to log in with your Anthropic account.

::: {.callout-note}
## Anthropic Account
You'll need an Anthropic account with API access. If you're a lab member, ask for credentials.
:::

## 7. Quarto (Optional)

Quarto is useful for creating reports and documents. This book was built with Quarto.

### macOS

```bash
brew install quarto
```

Or download from [https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

### Windows

Download and run the installer from [https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

## Verification Checklist

Run these commands to verify everything is installed:

```bash
# Check each tool
positron --version  # Or just open Positron
conda --version
R --version
git --version
claude --version
quarto --version    # If installed
```

All commands should return version numbers without errors.

::: {.callout-tip}
## Troubleshooting
If any command fails with "command not found":

- **macOS**: Try opening a new terminal window
- **Windows**: Try opening a new PowerShell window
- Check that the tool's install directory is in your PATH

See [Troubleshooting](../part3/troubleshooting.qmd) for common issues.
:::
